title: Scrinia Ceciliana, mysteries of state & government in letters of the late famous Lord Burghley, and other grand ministers of state, in the reigns of Queen Elizabeth, and King James, being a further additional supplement of the Cabala.
author: Bacon, Francis, 1561-1626.
publisher: Printed for G. Bedel and T. Collins ...,
notes: Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary, New York.
Appears also as part III of the Cabala, sive, Scrinia sacra.
Sir Francis Bacon's Discourse touching helps for the intellectual powers, and a letter to the King [p. 97-104] are inserted between p. 104 and 105.
Most of the letters are by Sir Francis Bacon, others by William Cecil, Baron Burghley, Sir Philip Sidney and Sir Nicholas Throckmorton.
